content:
Full FHIR agenda is here: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIRI/FHIR+WGM+Agenda+2020-09
Key FHIR-I topic sessions are scheduled as follows:

  • Mon 18:00 - CapabilityStatement rework
  • Tue 18:00 - Future of GraphDefinition
  • Wed: 14:00 - Review patterns
  • Thur 18:00 - Subscription
  • Fri: 14:00 R5 planning
    All times in Eastern

there is a discrepancy in the Whova schedule... it has Wed (Review patterns) listed as 18:00 ET and Fri (R5 planning) listed as 16:00 ET, not 14:00 ET ... I assume Whova schedule wins, since the Zoom meetings are driven by that
At least on Wednesday, 16:00 ET is for the plenary session...
If you any topic other than the 5 listed above, please let me know. I will add to the agenda.
The agenda lists Patient Administration doing FHIR Trackers from 1200-1400. Is PA actually meeting now?
no. That agenda is approximately 80% correct.
The cost of the virtual meeting.... we are still learning how to do this.

@Yunwei Wang @Rob Hausam and I would like to to raise the issue which is currently being discussed here: https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/179166-implementers/topic/Slicing.20non-repeating.20elements.20to.20define.20a.20choice

If it's not too late, it would be great if we could add it to the agenda.
I suspect it is too late
to add it to the agenda for this meeting, that is
You mean today or the whole week?
Is this Vocab related?
Not really I would say, it's all about slicing rules
FHIR-I's schedule is pretty full. Unless @Lloyd McKenzie can find a spot to squeeze it in. At least, I can add it to Monday's weekly conference call.
No problem :) Thanks for the feedback.
May be better to try to take it up on one of our future regular con-calls
Has anyone created FHIR-I attendance google sheet?
No. I will
There is a confluence template for attendance sheet. I will give it a try
bit.ly/fhiri
Now up-to-date again
If you'd rather do on Confluence, that's fine too
Love our own google sheet better. Confluence template does not allow me to remove quarters which we don't meet
Is our quarter with clinical genomics staring now? Just want to make sure I'm missing the connection.
("waiting for host")
And II, but it says the same for me
Connected!
Anybody know if it's possible to configure whova to mute people by default?
My audio is always unmuted whenever I connect
No, but I want the same thing.

Hi everyone,

Here's the FHIR-I agenda: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIRI/2021-Jan+FHIR-I+Agenda
Any chance May is posted -- I can't seem to find it!
I saw FHIR-I WGM sessions in Whova - the first is at 4 am Central on Monday :grinning:
I'll be posting the slightly more detailed schedule for FHIR-I later today. There won't be a cross-WG amalgamated schedule though.
https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIRI/FHIR+Infrastructure+Agenda+WGM+202105
We have our Q4 scheduled in 30min as "Carry-over" -- are we planning to use it? (@FHIR-I Co-chairs)
Yes. We'll wade through tracker items

Draft agenda is posted here: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIRI/FHIR+Infrastructure+Agenda+WGM+202109

On the call, no one expressed preferences for when certain topics should be held. If you'd like to see a topic shifted around, propose a swap and if no one objects within a few business days, I'll make the change.

Looking at SMARTv2 quarter -- we've worked through all the open ballot issues (and have some discussion slated next week for some follow-ups), so I don't anticipate we'd need a quarter at the WGM for this. But, if there are topics folks would like to discuss in a WGM quarter, I'm certainly up for that. Or if folks want time for a tour / discussion of resolved and applied ballot changes, I'm open to that too. Please chime in here if you want a SMARTv2 quarter :-)

Looking at Bulk Data quarter -- we've worked through all the open ballot issues and applied all changes, so I don't anticipate we'd need a quarter at the WGM for this. But, if there are topics folks would like to discuss in a WGM quarter, I'm certainly up for that. Or if folks want time for a tour / discussion of resolved and applied ballot changes, I'm open to that too. Please chime in here if you want a Bulk Data quarter :-)
(Note, we may want to add a quarter or a chunk of one to talk about Must-Support requirements, particularly with respect to inheritance.)
@Lloyd McKenzie based on the radio silence, I think we can probably un-schedule these SMART launch + Bulk data quarters.
Ok
It looks like I'll have Q3 conflicts Wed and Thu next week.
Ok. Updated the schedule
I will not be available on Tue Q3 and Thr Q2. I have updated the schedule. ;)

One slight remark on the meeting notes: under section "Q2 - TestScript project", it states that FHIR-32867 was discussed and voted on. This should probably be different as that's a Financial Mgmt tracker item with a different vote.
@Richard Ettema - do you know what the right tracker is?
FHIR-33867
@Alexander Zautke - thanks for the close read. Now fixed
Hi -- is there an agenda yet for the Jan 2022 WGM?
Not yet. @Lloyd McKenzie Can we discuss that on Jan 10th?
I think so. Connectathon won't have kicked off yet, so we should be ok.
Hi @Lloyd McKenzie: Max Masnick would like to use Tuesday Q2 for introduction/discussion about data dictionary generation. Could you add that to our agenda? cc @Max Masnick
Is there a joint call with InM scheduled?
Not at present that I'm aware of or that's scheduled in Whova. We have some time available Thur Q3 or Fri Q1 and, if needed, could probably fit you in to Wed Q2.

Can be found here: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIRI/FHIR+Infrastructure+Agenda+WGM+202201
We have a number of slots that are focused on tracker items that we could theoretically open up for other topics. Also, @Richard Ettema and @Patrick Murta - we've slotted in sessions for TestScript and FAST ballot reconciliation - can you confirm:
a) that you want a slot; and
b) whether the proposed slots will work and, if not, propose some that might work better?
@Lloyd McKenzie, the only TestScript related discussion I have is reviewing the FMM level for R5. Hoping to get it up to at least 3 or 4. The Wed Q3 slot is good. Thanks.
